Name: Applied Partial Differential Equations (Undergraduate Texts in Mathematics)

ReviewList.Text: You can't go wrong reading this.  It gives information in a very readable and coherent presentation.  I was surprised since the subject is so difficult.  Highly recommended.

This book takes a very complicated subject and explains it in a clear way. Even though it is not a long book, it covers a lot of material, but it focuses on giving a general overview and conceptual understanding rather than long proofs.  Some parts of the book are more thorough then others, so I would recommend supplementing with additional readings.

This book is a great, semi-formal approach to PDEs. Was used in a PDE class during my undergrad, and I would recommend it for anyone interested in sharpening up their PDE skills. It has many nice applications to the sciences (many biology examples). Most of the book is very readable, and enjoyable.
A math book that actually makes some sense.
